本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
All lessons will be on campus face-to-face style. Google Classroom will be used for some assignment information and submissions for all students so students need a Google account. Class time will NOT be spent watching movies or television shows, but rather, students will be expected to view assigned movies and television shows outside of class and be prepared to discuss them with their classmates during lessons. Finally, students will be asked to do an individual presentation at the end of the semester. This course is NOT a lecture style course, it requires students to have interactive discussions with classmates speaking only in English. The teacher will use Google Classroom for some course information and assignment submissions.
*INFORMATION FOR STUDENTS PERMITTED TO TAKE CLASSES ONLINE: If you cannot attend face-to-face classes for medical reasons (officially approved by the university before the semester begins) then you will need to join all lessons live using Zoom (Simultaneous two-way online broadcast of face-to-face classes). For some activities that are not possible through Zoom, students might be required to complete additional asynchronous on demand style assignments also.

トピック.授業計画1:
This class is conducted entirely in English and students will be expected to ONLY speak English during class.
Students will be expected to actively participate in lengthy discussions with their classmates each week.
This is NOT a lecture style course, it requires interactive discussions with classmates during every class.
トピック.授業外学習2: Class time will NOT be spent watching full movies or television shows, but rather, students will be expected to view some movies and television shows outside of class time and be prepared to discuss their opinions about them with their classmates during lessons. Students will also need to watch many music videos (mostly on YouTube) outside of class time and then be prepared to explain their opinion about the songs during class discussions. Students will NOT need to purchase any music or movies for this course.
